subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Sociological question
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I think doing the ITC experiments themselves certainly wouldn't be harmful
or produce a negative effect. Other than that, it might depend on what kind
of responses you get - whether they are positive or nevative.
In any case it certainly would not be the worst thing a young child could
experience. Parents having a fight in front of them would be far worse IMO.

Zack


On Thu, Jan 22, 2009 at 9:57 AM, Rick <rasterer@...> wrote:

>   I was wondering if anyone had an opinion on the impact of performing
> ITC experiments or sessions, when there are young children around. Do
> you think the children seeing their parents or others (in person, not
> on TV) engaging in this activity would have an effect on the children,
> and if so, do you think the effect would be positive, or negative?
>
